title: Gao Fitness Experience minimalist fitness blog (frontend)

requirements.summary: Build a minimalist modern blog UI branded “Gao Fitness Experience” that fetches and renders posts and refreshes as new posts are created.
acceptanceCriteria: The site header/hero prominently displays the site name “Gao Fitness Experience”.
The homepage renders a list of blog posts fetched from the backend, showing at minimum title and content (and created date if available).
Empty-state is handled gracefully when there are no posts (English text).
All user-facing text is in English.

file_operations.description: Create the main app view that renders a single-page homepage (no extra routes) with: a hero/header showing “Gao Fitness Experience”, the posts feed, and a site-wide footer via a shared layout component. Wire in the posts query so the list updates when refetched. Use shadcn-ui composed components (e.g., Card/Separator/Typography wrappers) for a clean editorial layout. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add a React Query hook that fetches the post list from the backend (using the typed backend interface) and exposes loading/empty/error states plus a refetch mechanism for UI updates.

Implement a small typed backend client wrapper that uses the existing core-infrastructure backend connection configuration to call backend methods (e.g., getPosts). Keep it anonymous by default (no auth flow) and compatible with React Query consumers.

Create a presentational component that renders the posts list (title + content, and date only if available) and shows an English empty state when there are no posts. Use shadcn-ui composed components for post cards and spacing. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Ensure the app imports and renders the newly created App component correctly and that React Query provider setup supports refetching to reflect newly created posts.

requirements.summary: Add a site-wide footer with an English “All rights reserved” notice including the brand name “Gao Fitness Experience”.
acceptanceCriteria: Footer is visible on all pages/views.
Footer text includes the exact brand name “Gao Fitness Experience” and an “All rights reserved” notice in English.

file_operations.description: Create a shared layout component that wraps the page content and includes a footer with the exact brand name “Gao Fitness Experience” and an English “All rights reserved” notice. Use shadcn-ui composed primitives (e.g., Separator) for a minimalist divider. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wrap the homepage content with SiteLayout so the footer is consistently visible across the rendered view(s).

requirements.summary: Apply a consistent minimalist editorial theme (non-blue/purple primary) across header, post list, and footer with responsive typography and spacing.
acceptanceCriteria: A coherent theme is applied consistently across header, post list, and footer.
Primary palette is not blue/purple (unless used only as minor accents).
Typography and spacing are consistent and readable on mobile and desktop.

file_operations.description: Define global theme tokens and base typography/spacing for a minimalist editorial feel using a neutral/earth-tone primary palette (avoid blue/purple as primary). Apply consistent defaults for body background, text, headings, and link styles.

Adjust Tailwind theme extensions (if needed) to support the chosen non-blue/purple primary palette and consistent typographic scale/spacing utilities used by the layout, header, post feed, and footer.

Apply consistent responsive container width, padding, and typographic hierarchy so header/hero, content, and footer align visually and read well on mobile and desktop. Use shadcn-ui composed components where helpful. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Align post card typography, spacing, and separators with the global theme for a consistent modern editorial look. Use shadcn-ui composed components where helpful. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
